page.title: 01THE HEMPLOE HILLS/COLD ASHBY
page.content: The village of Cold Ashby stands on the edge of a range of hills as the Hemploes. The hills are formed of iron stone overlain in places with very thick deposits of river gravel. To the north and east as the village this ground is in process of being quarried. Some of the areas previously quarried are now used for disposal of waste, and some as a reservoir. In addition to storing for domestic use, this provides a recreation facility. The only other important industry in this area is agriculture. Some peopple living in the area work in the quarry and on the farms, but many travel to nearby towns to work.
